homepage.title: Go Backend Engineer Roadmap 2025
homepage.subtitle: Master the skills needed for top-tier interviews
homepage.description: A comprehensive path from Frontend developer to Senior Backend Go Engineer in top-tier companies
homepage.contentsDescription: Modules are organized from basic Go concepts to advanced system patterns. Then there are additional cycles of articles on various topics.
homepage.readyToStartDescription: Join thousands of developers who are already improving their skills
homepage.completedModules: You completed {completed} of {total} modules. Keep learning!

module1.title: Go Language Mastery
module1.description: Here you can learn Go, starting from basics, including many subtleties and features of Go runtime and GMP model.

topics.t1_4: Control structures: if, for, switch, defer
topics.t1_6: Pointers: when to use, pass by value vs reference
topics.t1_7: Goroutines: creation, lifecycle, vs OS threads
topics.t1_8: Channels: unbuffered vs buffered, select statement
topics.t1_14: GMP model: Goroutines, OS threads, Processors
topics.t1_15: Memory management: stack vs heap, escape analysis
topics.t1_18: Unsafe operations: when and why to avoid

module2.title: Network Programming Mastery
module2.description: Deep dive into network programming: protocols, HTTP, WebSockets, network application performance.

topics.t2_1: OSI model: layers, responsibilities, real examples
topics.t2_2: TCP/IP stack: IP, TCP, UDP basics
topics.t2_3: DNS: resolution process, types of records
topics.t2_4: HTTP basics: methods, status codes, headers
topics.t2_7: net package: TCP/UDP clients and servers

module7.title: DevOps & Deployment
module7.description: Containerization, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipeline, deployment strategies for production applications.

module15.title: FAANG Interview Mastery
module15.description: Final preparation for interviews: coding, system design, behavioral questions.
